10th anniversary of  DPRK-Morocco relations
   Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and a film show were held here on Monday in the name of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Korea-Morocco Friendship Association to mark the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Kingdom of Morocco.     Present there were vice-chairman Choe Jong Hwan of the Committee and Citizens.   The participants saw a Moroccan documentary film introducing realities of Morocco yesterday and today.   And they looked round exhibited photos.

articles.title: 10th anniversary of  DPRK-Morocco relations

Kim Jong Il's work published in Italy
   Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The famous work of General Secretary Kim Jong Il "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully Through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was brought out in booklet by the Datanews Publishing House of Italy on the occasion of his 57th birthday.     The work published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998) clarified the five-point policy of great national unity:  Adhering  to the principle of national independence, uniting  under the banner of patriotism, improving the north-south relations, rejecting domination of foreign forces and fighting  against the anti-reunification forces, holding  contacts, promoting dialogue and strengthening solidarity among all the Koreans.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work published in Italy

National Day of Brunei marked
    Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held here on Monday in the name of the Korea-Brunei Friendship Association to mark the 15th National Day of Brunei.     Present at the meeting were Choe Jong Hwan, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the Korea-Brunei Friendship Association, and citizens.     A speech was made and a message of greetings to the Sultan of Brunei was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: National Day of Brunei marked

DPRK order awarded to Japanese
    Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The friendship order first class of the DPRK was awarded to Takashi Nada, president of the Shikoku, Japan, Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, with due ceremony at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.     This order was conferred on him in recognition of his devoted service in following and widely disseminating the Juche idea and conducting energetic activities in support of the Korean people's struggle for socialist construction and national reunification.      Present at the ceremony were Ri Jong Ok, Honorary vice-President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and others.

articles.title: DPRK order awarded to Japanese

"People's victory 21" steps up 
   Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The "people's victory 21" is stepping up the building of a progressive political party, a South Korean newspaper said.     The organization held a "roundtable meeting for proposing foundation of a progressive political party" with the attendance of some 200 personages at the end of January and published an overture, in which it said for workers to rise up voluntarily and unite around a progressive political party was an immediate task which brooks no further delay.  It also declared that it would hold the 2nd meeting within February to form a preparatory committee for founding the party and inaugurate it before May.     The "Korean Confederation of Trade Unions" with hundreds of thousands of unionists decided to take part in the building of a progressive political party and is joining it, the newspaper said, adding:   It is noticeable that a new progressive political party "is striking roots into comparatively fertile soil" which is different from the past.

articles.title: "People's victory 21" steps up

40th anniversary of signing of Korean-Chinese agreements
   Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the general bureau of Civil Aviation co-hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Monday on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the signing of agreements on cultural cooperation and air transport between the governments of the DPRK and China.     Invited to the reception were Wan Yongxiang, Chinese ambassador to Korea, and officials of the Chinese Civil Aviation Mission.     Present were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Song Sok Hwan, vice-Minister of Culture.

articles.title: 40th anniversary of signing of Korean-Chinese agreements

Choe Thae Bok meets Romanian party representative
    Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, alternate member of the political bureau  and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, today met and had a friendly talk with Amusa Stefan, first vice-chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania  who is its representative.   Amusa Stefan expressed the firm belief that the Korean people would certainly climb up a high peak of socialism by achieving the cause of national reunification under the guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok meets Romanian party representative

Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Jo Sun Baek
   Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the bier of colonel general of the KPA Jo Sun Baek, member of the WPK Central Committee, to express deep condolences over his death.     Jo died of illness yesterday at the age of 73.     He contributed to implementing the WPK's military line and defending gains of the revolution, holding an important post of an organ of armed forces for long.     The Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK published his obituary yesterday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Jo Sun Baek

Paek Nam Sun meets Nigerian ambassador
    Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, Foreign Minister of the DPRK, today met and had a conversation with Nigerian ambassador to Korea Olugbenga Ayodeji Ashiru who paid a farewell call on him.
